title: Roman Dining Couches
description: A short lesson to help you apply Roman Dining Couches.

hook.text: Romans didn't sit for dinner. They reclined on U-shaped couches, eating with one hand while lying on their side.

buildup.text: The triclinium (dining room) had three couches, each seating three diners. Your position signaled your social rank.

discovery.text: The host sat at the bottom. The guest of honor reclined at the top leftâ€”closest to the host, in the power spot.

twist.text: Women initially weren't allowed on couchesâ€”they sat upright on chairs. By late Rome, this rule was quietly dropped.

climax.text: Reclining dining disappeared with Rome's fall and didn't return until the chaise longue revival 1,400 years later.

options: Your social rank among the guests
Your food preferences for the evening
How much wine you planned to drink
